paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: One interesting case is CAP52, a 45‐year‐old man found to be affected by LQTs during hospital admission for pulmonary embolism.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Markedly prolonged QT interval, hospitalized after syncopal events.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The variant has also been identified in the proband's son and daughter.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Affected by LQTS, shows a less severe phenotype.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The 4‐year‐old daughter is affected by LQTS as the father and brother but apparently shows a less severe phenotype.

functional_data.summary: The variant is in a transmembrane helix region of a voltage-activated potassium channel that repolarizes the ventricular action potential.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is described as unknown and has been identified in multiple family members.
key_quotes: One interesting case is CAP52, a 45‐year‐old man found to be affected by LQTs during hospital admission for pulmonary embolism.
The variant has also been identified in the proband's son and daughter.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the KCNH2 gene was successfully extracted.
